== Contact Us ==

* For General Questions, Support Questions, Feedback and/or Suggestions, please '''subscribe''' to our <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/lubuntu-users | General Mailing List]]</nowiki>.

* For Development Questions, Testing Questions, and anything related to Lubuntu+1 Release, please '''join''' <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~lubuntu-dev | Lubuntu dev Team]]</nowiki>. 

* For specific topics, please see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Lubuntu/SubTeams | Lubuntu Sub-Teams]]</nowiki>.

== Ask for Help & Support ==
You are asking for Help and Support because you did not find what you are looking for on <nowiki>[[http://www.google.com | Google]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/www.googlubuntu.com | Google Ubuntu Search Engine]]</nowiki>. It is important to start from there as you may find the answer that you need without waiting for someone else to provide you with the same answer.

Please read <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support/community | Community support Overview]]</nowiki>

=== Mailing List ===
As Described above.

=== Ubuntu Forums ===

'''<nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/ | Ubuntu Forums]]</nowiki>''' has many sections divided as per the categories and the nature of the content.
* If you are a newcomer, we recommend to use <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=326 | Absolute Beginners Section]]</nowiki>.
* If you are an average/advanced user, you can use <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=327 | Ubuntu General Support]]</nowiki>.

Please remember to use the '''Lubuntu prefix''' when posting, this will ensure a faster response to your thread. This is very important so please don't forget that.

* '''Before starting a new thread, please search for a similar issue'''. 

=== LXDE Forum ===
'''Now, there is a dedicated area on LXDE Forum for Lubuntu - Please, <nowiki>[[http://forum.lxde.org/viewforum.php?f=38 | see this]]</nowiki>'''.

* You may also use the <nowiki>[[http://forum.lxde.org/ | LXDE forum]]</nowiki> for questions about LXDE components.

=== LXQt Forum ===
You may also use the <nowiki>[[https://forum.lxqt.org/ | LXQt forum]]</nowiki> for questions about LXQt components.

=== Live Chat ===
You can ask any Ubuntu question in our text live chat channel.  <nowiki>[[http://www.eifl.net/irc-beginners-guide | What is IRC?]]</nowiki>

General Lubuntu Support is  <nowiki>[[http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=lubuntu | #Lubuntu on Freenode.net IRC]]</nowiki>.  We need more volunteers here, if your question is not answered, wait another 30 minutes before reposting. Please read the guide to asking questions: <nowiki>[[http://workaround.org/getting-help-on-irc |"How to get help on IRC"]]</nowiki><<BR>>

For more information, please see <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetRelayChat|IRC Documentation]]</nowiki>.

=== Ask Ubuntu ===
Do you have a specific question with a specific answer?<<BR>>
Ask on <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/questions/tagged/lubuntu | Ask Ubuntu.]]</nowiki> Tag your post with Lubuntu.  

== See Also ==

=== Facebook Group ===
This is '''NOT''' a support channel but rather to be used as a channel where you can find news, updates, tips, etc. <nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/groups/lubuntu.official/ | Lubuntu Official Group on Facebook]]</nowiki> is a general areas for us to meet and hang out, please '''do not''' use it for support questions.
